Key Match Events: Hungary led in the 32nd minute when Tijjani Reijnders lost possession in midfield and Zsolt Nagy's cross to the back post was volleyed into the net by Roland Sallai
Denzel Dumfries headed in Cody Gakpo's free kick to equalise
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary had been hoping for a first win over the Netherlands in 40 years
Post-Match Reflections: Dumfries praised the players for their fight
Dumfries, who finished the game wearing Van Dijk's captain's armband, praised the team for holding their ground
Van Dijk said he was allowed to talk to the referee and did it in a respectful way, but gave the referee a reason to give a yellow card with the second one
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany lead the Group A3 table at the halfway mark with seven points from their three games
Hungary had over 80 per cent possession in the first half but did not create all that much in the way of chances
The Dutch grew in frustration, Van Dijk was yellow-carded for dissent before a second booking for a foul left the visitors with 10 men for the final 11 minutes
